title: JamesBorn
author: JamesBorn
content: Is good to touch lives with whatever you're blessed with, sometimes strangers need us, your family and relatives, friends. When you touch lives with sources of income you keep increasing. Yesterday I batch into a wonderful family of a mother with 3 kids scout on road begging to eat, from her stories they loss their father and nothing was left for the family. Nothing much on me, I quickly place $200 withdrawal and I took the family to mini market bought food items, cloths for the kids and toiletries. Give the remaining change balance to her. They close begging that yesterday, I slept well yesterday feeling good to help others plus their prayers for me. No pictures taken for public reputations.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: You start useless new threads everyday, when will you stop? When every member puts you on their ignore list?

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: This is not in any way related to Bitcoin, so this thread doesn't fit in this board. Nice one, mate. It's actually good to help people that are in need if we have anything at hand. But I usually don't buy the idea that when we help people, we come out in public to announce that we have actually helped them; it looks like helping while at the same time mocking those who you have helped in public. And I also don't see much need for announcing it here since the people you helped aren't here in this forum.Nevertheless, may you continue your good deeds; if your intentions are good, they will definitely pay off. Edit: have not gone through the OP's post history, don't know this was one of his usual ways. What's the point of creating bunch of threads? or probably a way for merit fishing ðŸ¤·

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: This does not worth creating a thread for, because you just did a charity which is something everyone is encouraged to do, it should be in our nature to bless others and as a matter of fact, this should become a lifestyle for all of us. I am not surprised to see another self-claimed helper who just creates a thread to discuss nothing, because this does not have any thing in connection with Bitcoin discussions, because you used your fiat to pay for the goods you bought for the poor widow.

comments.author: Mr.suevie
comments.body: Quote from: JamesBorn on April 15, 2023, 11:17:04 AMIs good to touch lives with whatever you're blessed with, sometimes strangers need us, your family and relatives, friends. When you touch lives with sources of income you keep increasing. Yesterday I batch into a wonderful family of a mother with 3 kids scout on road begging to eat, from her stories they loss their father and nothing was left for the family. Nothing much on me, I quickly place $200 withdrawal and I took the family to mini market bought food items, cloths for the kids and toiletries. Give the remaining change balance to her. They close begging that yesterday, I slept well yesterday feeling good to help others plus their prayers for me. No pictures taken for public reputations. Bravo mate welldone, you did a very good work but their is no need posting about your good-deed here since its not even related to bitcoin and its totally off topic to what is been discussÂ  here in the forum. The forum is place where we share knowledge about bitcoin and help those who are in new to the technology and also share update on recent happenings in the world of crypto. I think you should just join in the conversation here instead of making it a must to be always creating post when you have nothing to share related to bitcoin.

comments.author: yudi09
comments.body: Quote from: JamesBorn on April 15, 2023, 11:17:04 AMIs good to touch lives with whatever you're blessed with, sometimes strangers need us, your family and relatives, friends. When you touch lives with sources of income you keep increasing. Yesterday I batch into a wonderful family of a mother with 3 kids scout on road begging to eat, from her stories they loss their father and nothing was left for the family. Nothing much on me, I quickly place $200 withdrawal and I took the family to mini market bought food items, cloths for the kids and toiletries. Give the remaining change balance to her. May you be blessed with what you have done for them. It seems to me that you have spread love through Bitcoin even though there is no documentation that you can show us.The more we help others in need, the more our income will not decrease even though logically it is not true.I totally support such a program.Sometimes the little things can have a big impact.Some of my friends after carrying out the Easter service some time ago, they also carried out the same social activities as you did, but they also did not document this moment.

comments.author: mvdheuvel1983
comments.body: Quote from: JamesBorn on April 15, 2023, 11:17:04 AM<...>I was like here you go again another thread on how bitcoin saved the day.Yes, you helped an indigent family. Great. Bravo. But you really do not need to make a thread for it.Imagine if all of us start creating threads like "I built a house for a single money with my bitcoin", "I donated my bitcoin to pay for the surgery of an indigent patient" blah blah blah. Do you think the forum will look good?Please as much as what you have done had come from the purest of intention, putting it here will make it look like you are hunting for merits and if you are criticize you may feel bad. So, please desist from it.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: JamesBorn on April 15, 2023, 11:17:04 AM~~~They close begging that yesterday, I slept well yesterday feeling good to help others plus their prayers for me. No pictures taken for public reputations. No photos were taken and yet you came to bitcointalk to tell the whole forum about your deed.The fact that you helped some certain people do not mean you have to start the whole whole world that you helped them.With the type of threads you keep opening I'm sure we'll get to see one about "how you kept your phone that's holding your wallet inside your pocket" or "how you saw a child playing with Bitcoin logo or a Bitcoin toy".

comments.author: DiMarxist
comments.body: The thread you post is not concerning bitcoin, this thread doesn't relate with bitcoin, andÂ  it's totally off topic to what is been discussÂ  here in the forum, yes you did a good thing by helping a poor widow and her children, that does not mean you will tell the world that you help a the poor. the forum is were we come together to acquire knowledge or know some basic knowledge of Bitcoin and understand bitcoin investments, and to learn from his other, and wereÂ  we share knowledge about bitcoin and help those who are in new to the technology and also share update on recent happenings in the world of crypto pls don't post unmeaningful threads on this forum.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: I didn't get you well. That means we should create threads for all the helps we render on the street every days. What is the connection between what you did and bitcoin? Or do you think astray Merits will come from somewhere? For the appreciation of the helped. Even the looks fabricated. You helped a beg on the street with the sum of $200 and not only that you took the whole family to shopping. Well I applaud you for the good work. Thanks you for touching life with your wealth.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Quote from: Z-tight on April 15, 2023, 11:21:25 AMYou start useless new threads everyday, when will you stop? When every member puts you on their ignore list?Sometimes before I open his/her thread I would just start laughing. This dude will not stop, expect another thread tomorrow Dear OP, whenever you do good, you don't need to create public awareness to make you feel good. The Father who sees you in secret will reward you in secret. The point I'm trying to make here is that most of us here affect lives in one way or the other but it's pointless bringing it here since it's not bitcoin-related.

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: It's good what you did to others, I'm just wondering what bitcoin has to do with the topic you made here? It seems that the connection is far away. What you did is like a testimony.Â  Â  Â  That's why the topic you want to convey here is not really related to the forum, I hope next time make something that is somewhat relevant to the forum topic. I will repeat that your good deeds are not wrong, it's just not in the right platform or section, maybe what you made a topic here.

comments.author: Lorence.xD
comments.body: Sounds good to be true, it's more like a makeup story that you've done a lot of effort just to give money. If you're gonna make a story that could motivate others to help then would be better to start from yourself. Plus why your threads are on Bitcoin discussion while your topic doesn't even mentioned Bitcoin? Just go to off-top or serious discussion because people wouldn't buy your story here. Hope you can differentiate topics that are related to certain discussion just for you to have interaction in the forum.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: JamesBorn on April 15, 2023, 11:17:04 AMIs good to touch lives with whatever you're blessed with, sometimes strangers need us, your family and relatives, friends. When you touch lives with sources of income you keep increasing. Yesterday I batch into a wonderful family of a mother with 3 kids scout on road begging to eat, from her stories they loss their father and nothing was left for the family. Nothing much on me, I quickly place $200 withdrawal and I took the family to mini market bought food items, cloths for the kids and toiletries. Give the remaining change balance to her. They close begging that yesterday, I slept well yesterday feeling good to help others plus their prayers for me. No pictures taken for public reputations. I don't get the reason for his thread but I appreciate your kind gesture. Are you telling us you help somebody with your Bitcoin or what? It's not proper to publicize what you do for people. Kind gestures should be personal. In my religion, if you give your left hand shouldn't know that your right hand is giving. But it is painful to know that people are suffering. And most of these nations suffer because of corruption. This is because most of these nations have natural resources that can fend for all their citizens.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Quote from: Z-tight on April 15, 2023, 11:21:25 AMYou start useless new threads everyday, when will you stop? When every member puts you on their ignore list?Since the 10th until now he has made a lot of threads and this is not very important but he continues to do it to attract a lot of attention maybe merit too?The story above I don't really believe what he said he just wants to get a lot of appreciation because he has given $ 200 to people who need it. LOLI know it's well intentioned but a bit skeptical to me.
